model 0.1.0
  • Reference

Estimated parameters.

estimated_parameter.Rd

This function estimates parameters like mean, standard deviation for a gamlss object. This function is very useful when the mean or standard deviation do not match with mu, sigma or some function of mu and/or sigma.

estimated_parameter(mod, fun = "mean", m = 100)

Arguments

mod

a gamlss object.
fun

the estimated parameter, by default is mean but can be change for sd or var.
m

a number to indicate the number of observations to simulate, by default its values is 100.

Value

estimated_parameter function returns a vector.

Details

The function obtains the fitted values for mu, sigma, nu and tau. The functions simulates m observations and then it obtains the mean/fun defined by the user.

Examples

# Example for NOrmal regression ------------------------
n <- 50
x <- runif(n=n)
y <- rnorm(n=n, mean=-5 + 10 * x, sd=exp(1 + 2 * x))
library(gamlss)
#> Loading required package: splines
#> Loading required package: gamlss.data
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'gamlss.data'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:datasets':
#> 
#>     sleep
#> Loading required package: gamlss.dist
#> Loading required package: MASS
#> Loading required package: nlme
#> Loading required package: parallel
#>  **********   GAMLSS Version 5.1-4  ********** 
#> For more on GAMLSS look at http://www.gamlss.org/
#> Type gamlssNews() to see new features/changes/bug fixes.
mod <- gamlss(y ~ x, sigma.fo=~x, family=NO)
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 1: Global Deviance = 340.4941 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 2: Global Deviance = 339.6621 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 3: Global Deviance = 339.661 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 4: Global Deviance = 339.661 
# To explore the coefficients
coef(mod, "mu")
#> (Intercept)           x 
#>   -6.737415   16.015761 
coef(mod, "sigma")
#> (Intercept)           x 
#>    1.108047    1.776101 

# Obtaining the means
m1 <- fitted(mod, what="mu")
m2 <- estimated_parameter(mod, m=10000, fun="mean")
# Obtaining the standard deviations
s1 <- fitted(mod, what="sigma")
s2 <- estimated_parameter(mod, m=10000, fun="sd")

# Comparing the estimated means
cor(m1, m2)
#> [1] 0.9999088
# Comparing the estimated standard deviations
cor(s1, s2)
#> [1] 0.9998705

# Example for GAmma regression --------------------------
n <- 50
x <- runif(n=n)
y <- rGA(n=n, mu=exp(-5 + 10 * x), sigma=exp(-1 + 2 * x))
mod <- gamlss(y ~ x, sigma.fo=~x, family=GA)
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 1: Global Deviance = -9.4469 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 2: Global Deviance = -17.5708 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 3: Global Deviance = -17.6536 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 4: Global Deviance = -17.6538 
# To explore the coefficients
coef(mod, "mu")
#> (Intercept)           x 
#>   -5.095443    9.634598 
coef(mod, "sigma")
#> (Intercept)           x 
#>   -1.026522    2.093336 

# Obtaining the means
m1 <- fitted(mod, what="mu")
m2 <- estimated_parameter(mod, m=10000, fun="mean")
# Obtaining the standard deviations
s1 <- fitted(mod, what="sigma")
s2 <- estimated_parameter(mod, m=10000, fun="sd")

# Comparing the estimated means
cor(m1, m2)
#> [1] 0.9996386
# Comparing the estimated standard deviations
# in GA parameterization standard devition = mu * sigma
cor(s1*m1, s2)
#> [1] 0.9996582
